actors.name: United States of America
actors.description: Global superpower with dominant military, economic, technological, and cultural influence. Leader in innovation, global finance, and international diplomacy.

sub_actors.name: Executive Office of the President
sub_actors.description: Core executive leadership headed by the President, responsible for implementing federal laws, conducting foreign policy, and serving as Commander in Chief of armed forces. Houses key advisory bodies including National Security Council.

sub_actors.name: United States Congress
sub_actors.description: Federal legislative branch consisting of Senate and House of Representatives. Holds constitutional authority for lawmaking, federal budget, declarations of war, and oversight of executive branch.

sub_actors.name: Supreme Court of the United States
sub_actors.description: Highest court in the federal judiciary, providing final interpretation of the Constitution and federal law. Shapes national policy through judicial review and constitutional interpretation.

sub_actors.name: Department of Defense
sub_actors.description: Manages all military branches and national security policy. Largest employer in the world, controlling vast resources and implementing U.S. military strategy globally.

sub_actors.name: Federal Reserve System
sub_actors.description: Central banking system of the US, controls monetary policy, regulates financial institutions, and maintains stability of the financial system. Critical influence on global economy.

sub_actors.name: Department of State
sub_actors.description: Lead foreign affairs agency, conducting diplomacy and managing international relations. Implements foreign policy and oversees diplomatic missions worldwide.

sub_actors.name: Central Intelligence Agency
sub_actors.description: Premier foreign intelligence service, gathering and analyzing national security information. Conducts covert operations and informs strategic decision-making.

sub_actors.name: Department of the Treasury
sub_actors.description: Manages federal finances, tax collection, public debt, and financial intelligence. Controls economic sanctions and oversees critical financial regulatory functions.

actors.name: People's Republic of China
actors.description: World's largest population, second-largest economy, rising military power, and dominant manufacturing hub. Key player in global trade and technology.

sub_actors.name: Chinese Communist Party (CCP)
sub_actors.description: Ruling political party that controls all aspects of governance, sets national policy direction, and maintains supreme authority over state institutions and military

sub_actors.name: State Council
sub_actors.description: Chief administrative authority of China, responsible for implementing national policies, managing economy, and overseeing government ministries

sub_actors.name: Central Military Commission
sub_actors.description: Supreme military command organization that controls and directs the People's Liberation Army, responsible for national defense policy

sub_actors.name: National People's Congress
sub_actors.description: China's national legislature, formally highest organ of state power, responsible for passing laws and supervising government operations

sub_actors.name: People's Bank of China
sub_actors.description: Central bank controlling monetary policy, managing currency, and regulating financial institutions

sub_actors.name: Ministry of State Security
sub_actors.description: Principal intelligence and security agency responsible for counter-intelligence, foreign intelligence, and internal security

sub_actors.name: Central Commission for Discipline Inspection
sub_actors.description: Chief anti-corruption agency that enforces internal rules and regulations within the CCP

sub_actors.name: National Development and Reform Commission
sub_actors.description: Macroeconomic management agency responsible for strategic economic planning, reform policies, and resource allocation

actors.name: European Union
actors.description: Powerful economic bloc and regulatory influencer, world's largest trading entity, and significant diplomatic force shaping global standards.

sub_actors.name: European Commission
sub_actors.description: Executive branch of the EU that proposes legislation, implements decisions, upholds treaties, and manages day-to-day business. Primary driver of EU policy and regulation.

sub_actors.name: European Parliament
sub_actors.description: Directly elected legislative body that passes EU laws jointly with Council, supervises EU institutions, and adopts the EU budget.

sub_actors.name: Council of the European Union
sub_actors.description: Voice of EU member governments, adopts EU laws and coordinates policies. Primary decision-making body where national ministers meet.

sub_actors.name: European Central Bank
sub_actors.description: Central bank for the euro and administers EU monetary policy. Controls inflation and maintains financial stability in the Eurozone.

sub_actors.name: Court of Justice of the European Union
sub_actors.description: Ensures EU law is interpreted and applied uniformly across member states. Final arbiter in disputes between EU institutions and members.

sub_actors.name: European Council
sub_actors.description: Comprises heads of state/government of member states, defines EU's overall political direction and priorities.

sub_actors.name: European External Action Service
sub_actors.description: EU's diplomatic service implementing foreign and security policy, managing diplomatic relations and strategic partnerships.

sub_actors.name: European Banking Authority
sub_actors.description: Regulatory agency ensuring effective banking supervision across EU financial sector, developing banking standards and stress tests.

actors.name: Apple Inc.
actors.description: Tech giant with unprecedented market value, driving global technological innovation and consumer behavior, with significant influence on digital economy.

sub_actors.name: Apple Board of Directors
sub_actors.description: Highest governing body that oversees corporate strategy, major decisions, and shareholder interests. Approves key executive appointments and major strategic initiatives.

sub_actors.name: Executive Leadership Team
sub_actors.description: C-suite executives led by CEO Tim Cook who manage day-to-day operations and implement strategic vision across all business units.

sub_actors.name: Product Development Division
sub_actors.description: Core innovation unit responsible for designing and developing Apple's flagship products, including iPhone, iPad, and Mac lines.

sub_actors.name: Software Engineering Division
sub_actors.description: Controls development of iOS, macOS, and other critical software platforms that power Apple's ecosystem.

sub_actors.name: Operations and Supply Chain
sub_actors.description: Manages global manufacturing, logistics, and supplier relationships critical to Apple's production capabilities.

sub_actors.name: Services Division
sub_actors.description: Oversees growing services ecosystem including App Store, Apple Music, iCloud, and other digital services revenue streams.

sub_actors.name: Legal and Global Security
sub_actors.description: Handles regulatory compliance, intellectual property protection, and security across global operations.

sub_actors.name: Machine Learning and AI Division
sub_actors.description: Drives artificial intelligence strategy and implementation across products and services, including Siri and CoreML frameworks.

actors.name: NATO
actors.description: Dominant military alliance ensuring Western security, shaping global military dynamics and international security policy.

sub_actors.name: North Atlantic Council (NAC)
sub_actors.description: Principal political decision-making body of NATO, consisting of permanent representatives from all member states. Makes consensus decisions on major policy issues and strategic direction.

sub_actors.name: Supreme Allied Commander Europe (SACEUR)
sub_actors.description: Top military commander responsible for all NATO military operations, leads Allied Command Operations (ACO), and serves as strategic military leader for the alliance.

sub_actors.name: Military Committee
sub_actors.description: Senior military authority composed of Chiefs of Defense from member nations, providing military advice to NAC and strategic direction to NATO military commanders.

sub_actors.name: Secretary General's Office
sub_actors.description: Principal spokesperson and chief executive of NATO, responsible for steering decision-making and representing the alliance internationally.

sub_actors.name: NATO Defense Planning Committee
sub_actors.description: Oversees alliance military planning, capability development, and defense policy coordination among member states.

sub_actors.name: Allied Command Transformation (ACT)
sub_actors.description: Strategic command responsible for NATO's military transformation, capability development, and future military readiness.

sub_actors.name: NATO Intelligence and Security Division
sub_actors.description: Provides strategic intelligence analysis and security assessments to support alliance decision-making and operations.

sub_actors.name: NATO Parliamentary Assembly
sub_actors.description: Interparliamentary organization linking national parliaments of member states, providing democratic oversight and policy recommendations.

actors.name: Microsoft Corporation
actors.description: Technology leader controlling crucial digital infrastructure, cloud computing, and enterprise software globally.

sub_actors.name: Microsoft Board of Directors
sub_actors.description: Highest governing body providing strategic oversight, major corporate decisions, and shareholder representation. Oversees executive leadership and long-term company direction.

sub_actors.name: Executive Leadership Team
sub_actors.description: C-suite executives led by CEO Satya Nadella, responsible for day-to-day operations, strategy execution, and corporate policy-making across all divisions.

sub_actors.name: Cloud + AI Division
sub_actors.description: Controls Azure cloud platform and AI development, representing Microsoft's largest revenue stream and strategic future direction.

sub_actors.name: Microsoft Office Division
sub_actors.description: Manages Office 365 and productivity software ecosystem, crucial for enterprise relationships and recurring revenue streams.

sub_actors.name: Windows + Devices Group
sub_actors.description: Oversees Windows OS development and hardware initiatives, maintaining Microsoft's core platform dominance.

sub_actors.name: Corporate Legal Affairs
sub_actors.description: Handles regulatory compliance, intellectual property, government relations, and legal strategy affecting global operations.

sub_actors.name: Microsoft Research
sub_actors.description: Advanced technology research division driving innovation and future product development across all company sectors.

sub_actors.name: Corporate Strategy Group
sub_actors.description: Responsible for M&A activities, strategic partnerships, and long-term corporate development initiatives.

actors.name: Russian Federation
actors.description: Major military power with vast natural resources, significant geopolitical influence, and strategic importance in global affairs.

sub_actors.name: Office of the President of Russia
sub_actors.description: Supreme executive authority headed by the President, wielding extensive constitutional powers over domestic and foreign policy, military command, and federal appointments

sub_actors.name: Security Council of Russia
sub_actors.description: Presidential advisory body coordinating national security policy, defense strategy, and internal security matters, comprising key military and intelligence leaders

sub_actors.name: Federal Security Service (FSB)
sub_actors.description: Primary security and intelligence agency responsible for internal security, counterintelligence, and border protection with significant political influence

sub_actors.name: United Russia Party
sub_actors.description: Dominant political party holding constitutional majority in parliament, closely aligned with presidential administration and implementing government policies

sub_actors.name: Russian Armed Forces General Staff
sub_actors.description: Central military command structure controlling all military branches, strategic planning, and military operations

sub_actors.name: Central Bank of Russia
sub_actors.description: National financial regulator controlling monetary policy, currency operations, and banking system supervision

sub_actors.name: State Duma
sub_actors.description: Lower house of Federal Assembly serving as primary legislative body, passing federal laws and approving state budget

sub_actors.name: Ministry of Defense
sub_actors.description: Federal ministry overseeing military forces, defense policy, and military-industrial complex

actors.name: World Bank Group
actors.description: Crucial international financial institution shaping global development policy and economic governance.

sub_actors.name: International Bank for Reconstruction and Development (IBRD)
sub_actors.description: The largest and original institution of the World Bank Group, providing loans, guarantees, and technical assistance to middle-income countries for sustainable development projects

sub_actors.name: International Development Association (IDA)
sub_actors.description: Offers concessional loans and grants to the world's poorest countries, focusing on reducing poverty through economic growth, reduced inequalities, and improved living conditions

sub_actors.name: Executive Board of Directors
sub_actors.description: Primary decision-making body representing 189 member countries, responsible for approving loans, policies, and strategic decisions for the World Bank Group

sub_actors.name: International Finance Corporation (IFC)
sub_actors.description: Focuses on private sector development in developing countries through investment and advisory services to build sustainable businesses

sub_actors.name: Development Committee
sub_actors.description: Joint ministerial committee advising the Boards of Governors on critical development issues and financial resources required to promote economic development

sub_actors.name: Multilateral Investment Guarantee Agency (MIGA)
sub_actors.description: Promotes foreign direct investment in developing countries by providing political risk insurance to investors and lenders

sub_actors.name: International Centre for Settlement of Investment Disputes (ICSID)
sub_actors.description: Provides international facilities for conciliation and arbitration of investment disputes between foreign investors and host countries

sub_actors.name: Independent Evaluation Group (IEG)
sub_actors.description: Conducts independent evaluations of World Bank Group activities to ensure accountability and improve development effectiveness

actors.name: Alphabet Inc.
actors.description: Parent company of Google, controlling global information flow, digital advertising, and advancing AI technology.

sub_actors.name: Google LLC
sub_actors.description: Core subsidiary handling search, advertising, cloud computing, and primary revenue generation. Controls majority of global search market and digital ad infrastructure.

sub_actors.name: Google AI/DeepMind
sub_actors.description: Leading AI research and development division driving company's artificial intelligence strategy and innovations across all products.

sub_actors.name: Alphabet Executive Leadership
sub_actors.description: C-suite executives and board of directors setting overall corporate strategy, governance, and resource allocation.

sub_actors.name: Google Cloud
sub_actors.description: Enterprise-focused division providing cloud computing services, competing with AWS and Azure for global cloud infrastructure.

sub_actors.name: YouTube
sub_actors.description: Video platform subsidiary controlling global video content distribution and monetization systems.

sub_actors.name: Android/Google Mobile
sub_actors.description: Division managing mobile operating system and ecosystem, controlling majority of global smartphone software platform.

sub_actors.name: X Development LLC
sub_actors.description: Research and development facility for moonshot technologies and long-term innovative projects.

sub_actors.name: Google Platforms & Ecosystems
sub_actors.description: Division overseeing core platforms including Chrome, Maps, and integrated software ecosystems.

actors.name: United Nations
actors.description: Principal international organization for global governance, peace-keeping, and international cooperation.

sub_actors.name: UN Security Council
sub_actors.description: Primary organ responsible for maintaining international peace and security, with power to impose sanctions and authorize military action. Five permanent members have veto power.

sub_actors.name: UN General Assembly
sub_actors.description: Main deliberative body where all 193 member states have equal representation, adopts resolutions on global issues and approves UN budget.

sub_actors.name: UN Secretariat
sub_actors.description: Executive arm led by Secretary-General, manages UN operations, implements policies, and mediates international disputes.

sub_actors.name: Economic and Social Council (ECOSOC)
sub_actors.description: Coordinates economic, social, and environmental work of UN agencies, promotes sustainable development and policy coherence.

sub_actors.name: International Court of Justice
sub_actors.description: Principal judicial organ of UN, settles legal disputes between states and provides advisory opinions on legal questions.

sub_actors.name: UN Peacekeeping Operations
sub_actors.description: Deploys military and civilian personnel globally to maintain peace, protect civilians, and support political processes.

sub_actors.name: UN Human Rights Council
sub_actors.description: Inter-governmental body responsible for promoting and protecting human rights worldwide, conducts Universal Periodic Review.

sub_actors.name: UN Development Programme (UNDP)
sub_actors.description: Global development agency working in 170 countries to eradicate poverty and reduce inequalities through sustainable development.
